alert.note: Alert for Metro Palm Beach County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 14 at 8:38AM EST until December 16 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following areas, Coastal Broward County, Coastal Miami Dade County, Coastal Palm Beach County, Metro Broward County, Metro Palm Beach County and Metropolitan Miami Dade. * WHEN...Until 7 PM EST this evening. * IMPACTS...Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Storm drains and ditches may become clogged with debris. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Scattered to numerous showers will continue across the region through the evening hours. There could be periods of heavy downpours with some of the showers over the east coast today. These downpours could drop an additional 1 to 2 inches of rain over a short period of time over grounds that are already saturated from recent heavy rainfall. Because of this, the Flood Watch will continue for the east coast metro areas through this evening. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
